Stage_0.name: Latent/Subclinical
Stage_0.description: Impaired lymphatic transport without clinical edema
Stage_0.clinical_features: No visible swelling, may have subjective heaviness
Stage_0.diagnosis: Lymphoscintigraphy abnormal, bioimpedance spectroscopy detects early changes
Stage_0.treatment: Surveillance, risk reduction counseling, consider prophylactic compression

Stage_I.name: Reversible/Mild
Stage_I.description: Accumulation of protein-rich fluid that reduces with elevation
Stage_I.clinical_features: Soft pitting edema, resolves overnight or with elevation
Stage_I.treatment: Complete decongestive therapy (CDT), compression garments, exercise

Stage_II.name: Spontaneously Irreversible/Moderate
Stage_II.description: Limb elevation alone rarely reduces swelling
Stage_II.clinical_features: Tissue fibrosis developing, may be pitting (IIa) or non-pitting (IIb)
Stage_II.substages: IIa - pitting present; IIb - non-pitting, brawny texture
Stage_II.reversibility: Does not reverse with elevation alone
Stage_II.treatment: Intensive CDT phase 1, then maintenance phase 2, consider surgery

Stage_III.name: Lymphostatic Elephantiasis/Severe
Stage_III.description: Massive swelling with trophic skin changes
Stage_III.skin_changes: Warty projections, thickened leathery skin, deep folds
Stage_III.reversibility: Significant reduction possible but residual deformity
Stage_III.treatment: Intensive CDT, debulking surgery, skin care, wound management

definition.@value: A standardized clinical staging system for lymphedema from Stage 0 (latent) through Stage III (lymphostatic elephantiasis) based on reversibility, tissue consistency, and skin changes.

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Describe the ISL staging system for lymphedema
Differentiate clinical features of each stage
Understand the concept of Stage 0 (latent) lymphedema
Match treatment intensity to disease stage
clinical_pearls: Stage 0 represents the WINDOW OF OPPORTUNITY - early detection allows early intervention
Bioimpedance spectroscopy can detect Stage 0 before visible swelling
Pitting vs non-pitting distinguishes Stage IIa from IIb
Stage III elephantiasis includes trophic skin changes (papillomatosis, hyperkeratosis)
Treatment intensity escalates with stage - early treatment prevents progression
